result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mariah M Shipley

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Order on Competency signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on 8/11/22

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
2:36 PM Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Priya Barnes in court for Mariah M Shipley.  Defendant's appearance is waived.
State requests the defendant be discharged from the commitment under 971.14(6).  State requests the defendant be discharged from conditions of bond and to suspend proceedings indefinitely.
No objection by the Defense.
Court finds the defendant not competent and not likely to become competent within the statutory commitment period.
Court orders the criminal proceedings be suspended and the defendant discharged from the criminal competency commitment.  Court orders the defendant be released from custody and from the conditions of bond.

Wisconsin Community Service report re: GPS Failure to pay. Received and filed

**Reviewed by Judge Bohren on August 10, 2022.**

filed by Dr. Deborah Collins.

  **Reviewed by Judge Bohren on August 5, 2022 - REVIEWED.**

addressed to: Mariah Shipley for hearing on July 22, 2022 at 10:30 a.m. 
Return to Sender, NIC at WCJ

ADDRESS INFO for Mariah M Shipley
Current: 407 Morrissey Dr, North Prairie, WI 53153 United States  (Effective: 07-25-2022)
Prior: 515 W Moreland Blvd, C/O Waukesha Co Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States
Information about legal guardian

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with her sister or the children in the home listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant to be released no later than 3:00 pm on 7/22/22 directly to her father, Ed Shipley, to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release for installation of the GPS unit and then be transported to A Peace of Mind Adult Family Home.  Defendant is to reside at A Peace of Mind Adult Family Home pending further order of the Court.  If defendant cannot be released by 3:00 pm on 7/22/22 she is to remain in custody and be released at 10:00 am on Monday, 7/25/22 under the same conditions listed above.

12:03 PM Defendant Mariah M Shipley in court, in custody, with attorney Priya Barnes.   Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jeffery Stache, Mary Wolf and Caprice Maxey also appear in court.
Case called for continued motion to modify bond.
Defense outlines the proposed changes to the bond conditions.
Statements by Mr. Stache.
Statements by the State.
Court grants the motion to modify bond and orders the cash bond converted to a signature bond with the conditions modified to have the defendant reside at A Peace of Mind Adult Family Home.
Hearing set for 8/11/22 to remain on the Court's calendar as previously scheduled.
Bail/bond hearing on July 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.

01:47 PM Defendant Mariah M Shipley in court, in custody, with attorney Priya Barnes.   Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court addresses motion to modify bail.  
Statements by the Defense regarding the status of the group home.  
Defense requests bond be modified to allow defendant to reside at the group home.
Defense requests that the Court order the Sheriff's Department to transport the defendant to the group home directly.
State is not opposed to secure placement at the group home but does not believe the Sheriff's Department can do the transport.
Court will continue this hearing to tomorrow to allow counsel to obtain more details.
Court will not make any changes to bail at this time.
  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing on July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

09:24 AM Defendant Mariah M Shipley in court, in custody, with attorney Priya Barnes.   Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for bail/bond hearing in 22CF1018.
Arguments by the Defense.
Arguments by the State.
For the reasons stated on the record the Court denies the motion to modify bond at this time and will address the issue again at the next hearing.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated July 4, 2022 requesting Bail Reduction Hearing. Per Atty. Barnes request a hearing has been scheduled for July 13, 2022.**
Bail/bond hearing on July 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Motion for Modification of Bail, filed by Atty. Barnes.   **Reviewed by Judge Bohren on July 7, 2022 - Clerk to schedule Bail/Bond hearing with parties.**
Review hearing on August 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Signed by Commissioner Rieck on 06/29/2022.

08:21 AM Defendant Mariah M Shipley in court, in custody, with attorney Priya Barnes.   Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Barnes previously filed a motion to dismiss.  Attorney Barnes makes arguments in support of her motion to dismiss for insufficient complaint and lack of personal jurisdiction.  The State responds to Attorney Barnes' arguments and agrees that Count 1 shall be dismissed but Count 2 shall remain.  Attorney Barnes further argues her motion specifically as to Count 2.  The Court will dismiss Count 1.  For reasons stated on the record and for today's purposes the Court will deny the motion as it relates to Count 2 with the understanding that further argument can be made at the contested competency hearing currently scheduled before the Trial Court on the defendant's other felony matter.  The State has concerns of proceeding at this point with a preliminary hearing given the statements made by Attorney Barnes.  COURT ORDERS FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2).  Court orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days.  The Court finds good cause to toll the time limits to the preliminary hearing and will set this matter before the Trial Court to tag along with the defendant's other matter currently scheduled for a competency hearing.  Bail remains as fixed.  Review hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 29, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Motion hearing on June 29, 2022 at 08:15 am.

01:12 PM Defendant Mariah M Shipley in court, in custody, with attorney Priya Barnes.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.  State would like time to review motion to dismiss.    Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:15 am.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Motion to dismiss complaint for lack of personal jurisdiction filed on 6/23. Sent to CC Herring for review.
State Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel, filed by Jeremy Perri.
Hearing on June 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with her sister or the children in the home listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.

01:51 PM Defendant Mariah M Shipley in court, in custody, with attorney Angela Wang.   Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Attorney Wang states attorney Priya Barnes is appointed on the defendants other cases and requests a status of counsel date in one week.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing and sets a status of counsel date.  Hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
